remarks: If there is a cycle of length 3 in a graph, there are three (different) vertices in the graph which are mutually connected by edges. (Contributed by Alexander van der Vekens, 9-Nov-2017.)
statement:
3v3e3cycl1 $p |- ( ( Fun E /\ F ( V Cycles E ) P /\ ( # ` F ) = 3 ) -> E. a e. V E. b e. V E. c e. V ( { a , b } e. ran E /\ { b , c } e. ran E /\ { c , a } e. ran E ) ) $.
$d E a b c $.
$d P a b c $.
$d V a b c $.
